SENT.plain: We report here the first case with Diamond-Blackfan anemia (DBA) who responded to rituximab
The patient is an 8-yr-old Japanese girl with refractory DBA accompanied by complex congenital heart disease
She received two doses of rituximab, 375 mg/m(2)/wk
She became transfusion independent 6 months after the treatment without any serious side effect
However, after 8 months of transfusion-free period, her condition returned to the pretreatment level with recovery of peripheral B cells
Rituximab may be a successful therapy for refractory DBA where B cells play a crucial role in the pathogenesis of the severe anemia
